poem:
**Charon's Embrace**

In the quiet reaches  
of the not-quite-planet,  
Pluto paused in its cold dance—  
a celestial kiss.  
Charon, captured in the moment,  
whirled in slow orbit,  
as if both were actors  
in a forgotten fable,  
spinning tales in the dark  
with only silence for applause.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Kiss and capture’: scientists offer new theory on how Pluto got its largest moon It sounds like one of Kipling’s Just So Stories but it is rooted in science: experts say they have a new theory for how Pluto got its largest moon. Pluto – once considered the ninth planet of our solar system, but now classified as a “dwarf planet” – has five known moons, of which Charon is the largest with a diameter". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
